title: Conjunction is Commutative
description:
Prove that logical AND is commutative: `P /\ Q -> Q /\ P`.

**Goal:** `forall P Q : Prop, P /\ Q -> Q /\ P`

To work with conjunctions in Coq:
- Use `destruct` to break apart a conjunction hypothesis into its components
- Use `split` to prove a conjunction by proving each part separately
hints: Use `intros` to introduce P, Q, and the hypothesis P /\ Q
Use `destruct` on the conjunction to get separate hypotheses for P and Q
Use `split` to break the goal Q /\ P into two subgoals
template:
Theorem and_commutative : forall P Q : Prop, P /\ Q -> Q /\ P.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem and_commutative : forall P Q : Prop, P /\ Q -> Q /\ P.
Proof.
  intros P Q H.
  destruct H as [HP HQ].
  split.
  - exact HQ.
  - exact HP.
Qed.
